org.latency4j.alert

Class MissedTargetAlertLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.alert.AbstractAlertHandler
      • org.latency4j.alert.MissedTargetAlertLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlertHandler

    public class MissedTargetAlertLogger
extends AbstractAlertHandler

    An alert handler implementation which logs alerts using the SLF4J logger abstraction API. The log-level and category with which messages are logged can be configured via the parameter list as specified via the AlertHandler.setParameters(java.util.Map) method.

    The log-level is specified via the parameter "logLevel". The parameter value must translate to one of the values of the Enum MissedTargetLogLevel. Where no log-level is specified, the default MissedTargetLogLevel.INFO is used.

    The logger category is specified via the parameter "logger.category". Where no value is specified for this parameter, the internal category Latency4JConstants.LATENCY4J_LOGGER_NAME is used.

    In addition to the logger specific parameters described above, this class also supports the parameters defined by the parent class AbstractAlertHandler.

    Note:Instances of this class must be initialised before use.

      • latencyDeviationExceededTolerance

        public void latencyDeviationExceededTolerance(StatisticalLatencyRequirement requirement,
                                              WorkDuration duration,
                                              double deviationFromMean,
                                              double mean)
        Description copied from interface: AlertHandler

        Invoked by a monitor when the duration/latency of a given task has exceeded the tolerance specified in the requirement governing it. This is only applicable to statistical requirements.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement which has been breached.
        duration - The duration of the task execution which has breached the specified requirement.
        deviationFromMean - The deviation from the allowed tolerance specified in the requirement.
        mean - The average latency/duration to date for calls falling within the scope of this requirement.
        See Also:
        StatisticalLatencyRequirement

      • latencyExceededCap

        public void latencyExceededCap(CappedLatencyRequirement requirement,
                               WorkDuration duration)
        Description copied from interface: AlertHandler

        Invoked when a task execution has exceeded the fixed latency cap specified in its governing requirement.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement that has been breached.
        duration - The duration of the task execution which has breached the requirement.
        See Also:
        CappedLatencyRequirement

      • workCategoryFailed

        public void workCategoryFailed(LatencyRequirement requirement,
                               WorkDuration duration)
        Description copied from interface: AlertHandler

        Called by a monitor to indicate that a task failed to complete due to an exception. This method would only be invoked if error reporting is enabled for the requirement being monitored.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The latency requirement related to the failed operation.
        duration - The duration of the operation up until the point that the exception or error occurred.

      • getLogger

        public org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()

        Returns a reference to the internal logger used by this instance for logging alerts.

        Returns:
        A reference to the internal alerts logger.
